name: Agrawal's conjecture
summary:
The cyclotomic AKS test in number theory is based on Agrawal's conjecture, which was proposed by Manindra Agrawal in 2002 [1]. Formally, Agrawal's conjecture says:

Assume two coprime positive integers, {\displaystyle n} and {\displaystyle r}. Either {\displaystyle n} is prime or {\displaystyle n^{2}\equiv 1{\pmod {r}}} if {\displaystyle (X-1)^{n}\equiv X^{n}-1{\pmod {n,\,X^{r}-1}}\,}
